info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 07 at 6:31PM EDT until July 07 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN ORANGE AND NORTHEASTERN ALBEMARLE COUNTIES... At 630 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles east of Orange to near Boswells Tavern to 7 miles northeast of Charlottesville, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Campbell, Hollymead, Gordonsville, Thornhill, Cobham, Cismont, Rhoadesville, Lahore, Verdiersville, Stony Point and Unionville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
